title: Fix Weekly Prayer Times table mobile horizontal scroll + sticky first column overlap

requirements.summary: Make the weekly prayer times table horizontally scrollable on mobile with a readable, visually separated sticky Day/Date first column and a stable minimum table width.
acceptanceCriteria: On small/mobile widths, the weekly table can be scrolled horizontally inside its own container without affecting other page content.
While horizontally scrolling, the first column (Day/Date) stays visually fixed and does not blend/overlap with adjacent columns; text remains clearly readable.
The sticky first column has an opaque background and a clear divider (border and/or shadow) so underlying scrolled columns do not show through.
The table has a consistent minimum width so columns do not collapse into each other when rendered on narrow screens.

file_operations.description: Adjust the weekly table wrapper and table classes to: (1) keep horizontal scrolling contained to this section (e.g., overflow-x on a dedicated scroller with max width containment), (2) apply a consistent min-width to the table so columns do not collapse on narrow screens, and (3) make the first column (header + body) sticky with an opaque background plus a clear separator (border/shadow) and appropriate z-index so it never visually merges with scrolled time columns. Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui.

Add narrowly-scoped global utility classes for the weekly prayer times scroller + sticky first column (e.g., sticky background treatment, right-side divider/shadow, and any needed stacking-context helpers) that can be applied from WeeklyPrayerTimesSection without changing immutable frontend/src/components/ui components.

requirements.summary: Ensure consistent sticky-column styling and layering between header and body cells in the Weekly Prayer Times table to prevent header/body mismatch and overlap during horizontal scroll.
acceptanceCriteria: The sticky 'Day' header cell and the sticky day/date body cells render with consistent layering and background, with no flicker or overlap during scroll.
No other UI elements in the Home tab overlap the table during horizontal scrolling.

file_operations.description: Unify the sticky first-column implementation across TableHead and TableCell by reusing the same class set (z-index, opaque background, divider/shadow). Ensure the table scroller establishes a safe stacking context (e.g., via a wrapper class) so other Home tab elements do not overlap the scrolling table area.
